wikipedia_page.main: Richard George Duckfield (2 July 1907 – 30 December 1959) was a Welsh cricketer who played first-class cricket for Glamorgan between 1930 and 1938 as a right-hand bat. Largely successful between 1932 and 1938, Duckfield held for a time the record high score for any Glamorgan player – 280 against Surrey. He retired from the game in 1938 after a loss of confidence in his own fielding, having scored exactly 7,000 runs.
